mdRecord.dcterms:description: This letter is not in Lee's hand, though it is signed and initialed by him. Lee writes to Longstreet on the subject of gold, to inform him of Grant's troop movements around the Petersburg lines, the potential of Union General Sherman marching towards Richmond from the south, potential routes of retreat for Confederate forces, and further strategy.
